rule-18-2-a.test_description: The baseline building is one floor and four zones in climate zone CZ4A with HVAC BAT = RESIDENTIAL.  The building is correctly modeled with Separate HVAC System 1 serving each zone.  Expected result: pass

standard.rule_description: Does the modeled system serve the appropriate zones (one system per zone for system types 1, 2, 3, 4, 9, 10, 11, 12, and 13 and one system per floor for system types 5, 6, 7, and 8, with the exception of system types 5 or 7 serving laboratory spaces - these systems should serve ALL laboratory zones in the buidling).

rule-18-2-b.test_description: The baseline building is one floor and four zones in climate zone CZ4A with HVAC BAT = RESIDENTIAL.  The building is incorrectly modeled with multiple zones served by HVAC System 1.  Expected result: fail

standard.rule_description: Does the modeled system serve the appropriate zones (one system per zone for system types 1, 2, 3, 4, 9, 10, 11, 12, and 13 and one system per floor for system types 5, 6, 7, and 8, with the exception of system types 5 or 7 serving laboratory spaces - these systems should serve ALL laboratory zones in the buidling).

rule-18-2-c.test_description: The baseline building is two floors and four zones in climate zone CZ1A with HVAC BAT = RETAIL.  The building is correctly modeled with one HVAC system 4 serving each zone.  Expected result: pass

standard.rule_description: Does the modeled system serve the appropriate zones (one system per zone for system types 1, 2, 3, 4, 9, 10, 11, 12, and 13 and one system per floor for system types 5, 6, 7, and 8, with the exception of system types 5 or 7 serving laboratory spaces - these systems should serve ALL laboratory zones in the buidling).

rule-18-2-d.test_description: The baseline building is two floors and four zones in climate zone CZ1A with HVAC BAT = RETAIL.  The building is incorrectly modeled with one HVAC system 4 per floor.  Expected result: fail

standard.rule_description: Does the modeled system serve the appropriate zones (one system per zone for system types 1, 2, 3, 4, 9, 10, 11, 12, and 13 and one system per floor for system types 5, 6, 7, and 8, with the exception of system types 5 or 7 serving laboratory spaces - these systems should serve ALL laboratory zones in the buidling).

rule-18-2-e.test_description: The baseline building is two floors and four zones in climate zone CZ4A with HVAC BAT = OTHER_NON_RESIDENTIAL.  The building area is 50,000 sf.  The building is correctly modeled with one HVAC system 5 per floor.  Expected result: pass

standard.rule_description: Does the modeled system serve the appropriate zones (one system per zone for system types 1, 2, 3, 4, 9, 10, 11, 12, and 13 and one system per floor for system types 5, 6, 7, and 8, with the exception of system types 5 or 7 serving laboratory spaces - these systems should serve ALL laboratory zones in the buidling).

rule-18-2-f.test_description: The baseline building is two floors and four zones in climate zone CZ4A with HVAC BAT = OTHER_NON_RESIDENTIAL.  The building area is 50,000 sf.  The building is incorrectly modeled with one HVAC system for the whole building.  Expected result: fail

standard.rule_description: Does the modeled system serve the appropriate zones (one system per zone for system types 1, 2, 3, 4, 9, 10, 11, 12, and 13 and one system per floor for system types 5, 6, 7, and 8, with the exception of system types 5 or 7 serving laboratory spaces - these systems should serve ALL laboratory zones in the buidling).

rule-18-2-g.test_description: The baseline building is two floors and four zones in climate zone CZ4A with HVAC BAT = OTHER_NON_RESIDENTIAL.  The building area is 50,000 sf.  The building has two laboratory zones with a total lab exhaust rate of 16,000 cfm.  The two exhaust zones are correctly served by one System 5 HVAC system.  The other two zones are each served by a System 5 HVAC system (one per floor).  Expected result: pass

standard.rule_description: Does the modeled system serve the appropriate zones (one system per zone for system types 1, 2, 3, 4, 9, 10, 11, 12, and 13 and one system per floor for system types 5, 6, 7, and 8, with the exception of system types 5 or 7 serving laboratory spaces - these systems should serve ALL laboratory zones in the buidling).

rule-18-2-h.test_description: The baseline building is two floors and four zones in climate zone CZ4A with HVAC BAT = OTHER_NON_RESIDENTIAL.  The building area is 50,000 sf.  The building has two laboratory zones with a total lab exhaust rate of 12,000 cfm.  The two exhaust zones are served by one System 5 HVAC system.  The other two zones are each served by a System 5 HVAC system (one per floor).  We expect an undetermined result because with a lab exhaust rate of 12,000 cfm, and 4,000cfm of system exhaust, it is not possible to tell if there is more than 15,000cfm of lab exhaust.  Expected result: undetermined

standard.rule_description: Does the modeled system serve the appropriate zones (one system per zone for system types 1, 2, 3, 4, 9, 10, 11, 12, and 13 and one system per floor for system types 5, 6, 7, and 8, with the exception of system types 5 or 7 serving laboratory spaces - these systems should serve ALL laboratory zones in the buidling).

rule-18-2-i.test_description: The baseline building is one floor and four zones with HVAC BAT = OTHER NON RESIDENTIAL.  Building area is 160,000 sf.  Thermal Zones 1 and 2 are type Laboratory with total 12,000 cfm of zone exhaust.  The building is modeled with one HVAC system 7 per floor and incorrectly with one HVAC system 7 for the Laboratory zones.  Expected result: fail

standard.rule_description: Does the modeled system serve the appropriate zones (one system per zone for system types 1, 2, 3, 4, 9, 10, 11, 12, and 13 and one system per floor for system types 5, 6, 7, and 8, with the exception of system types 5 or 7 serving laboratory spaces - these systems should serve ALL laboratory zones in the buidling).
